commit.message:
Fix 'GC_push_marked1 discards const qualifier' gcc error
(fix of commit 1ab17dedc)

Issue #629 (bdwgc)

* mark.c [USE_PUSH_MARKED_ACCELERATORS] (GC_push_marked1): Specify hhdr
argument as const pointer.
* mark.c [USE_PUSH_MARKED_ACCELERATORS && !UNALIGNED_PTRS]
(GC_push_marked2): Likewise.
* mark.c [USE_PUSH_MARKED_ACCELERATORS && !UNALIGNED_PTRS
&& GC_GRANULE_WORDS<4] (GC_push_marked4): Likewise.

Travis CI: Update cppcheck tool to v2.13.3

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

Workaround 'condition is always false in test_long_mult' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* tests/gctest.c [!NO_LONGLONG64 && CPPCHECK] (test_long_mult): Pass
address of hp and lp local variables to GC_noop1().

Workaround 'condition !setup_header() is always false' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* allchblk.c [MARK_BIT_PER_OBJ] (GC_allochblk_nth): Do not check result
of setup_header() (as it is always true); add comment.

Workaround 'uninitialized variable sp' cppcheck FP in setjmp_t.c

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* tools/setjmp_t.c [CPPCHECK] (nested_sp): Call
__builtin_frame_address(0) instead of &sp.

Workaround 'C-style casting' cppcheck warning in testcpp

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* tests/cpp.cc (main): Do not call GC_INIT() if CPPCHECK.

Workaround 'address of a symbol cannot be null' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

These warnings are reported for weak symbols.

* os_dep.c [LINUX_STACKBOTTOM && IA64 && USE_LIBC_PRIVATES]
(GC_get_register_stack_base): Declare and use
p_libc_ia64_register_backing_store_base local variable.
* os_dep.c [LINUX_STACKBOTTOM && IA64 && USE_LIBC_PRIVATES && CPPCHECK]
(GC_get_register_stack_base): Pass address of
p_libc_ia64_register_backing_store_base to GC_noop1(); add comment.
* os_dep.c [LINUX_STACKBOTTOM && USE_LIBC_PRIVATES]
(GC_linux_main_stack_base): Declare and use p_libc_stack_end local
variable.
* os_dep.c [LINUX_STACKBOTTOM && USE_LIBC_PRIVATES && CPPCHECK]
(GC_linux_main_stack_base): Pass address of p_libc_stack_end to
GC_noop1().

Workaround 'uninitialized variable bs_lo' cppcheck FP (E2K)

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* include/private/gc_priv.h [E2K] (PS_ALLOCA_BUF): Add pbuf argument;
change return type to void; store result to *pbuf instead.
* include/private/gc_priv.h [E2K && CPPCHECK] (PS_ALLOCA_BUF): Pass
pbuf to GC_noop1() as well; add comment.

Workaround 'or with zero is redundant' cppcheck FP
(fix of commit 229ceb396)

* misc.c [!GC_DISABLE_INCREMENTAL && CPPCHECK]
(GC_get_supported_vdbs): Declare zero local volatile variable; use zero
local variable instead of 0; add comment.

Workaround 'condition 0!=back_ptr is always true' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* backgraph.c [CPPCHECK] (ensure_struct): Pass &old_back_ptr to
GC_noop1() before comparing it to NULL; add comment.
* backgraph.c [CPPCHECK] (add_edge, backwards_height): Pass &pred to
GC_noop1() before comparing it to NULL.
* backgraph.c [CPPCHECK] (update_max_height): Pass &back_ptr to
GC_noop1() before comparing it to NULL.
* backgraph.c [CPPCHECK] (update_max_height): Initialize pred local
variable to back_ptr instead of calling GET_OH_BG_PTR(p) twice.

Workaround 'parameter can be declared as pointer to const' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* cord/tests/cordtest.c [CPPCHECK] (test_fn, id_cord_fn): Pass
client_data argument to GC_noop1().
* mark.c [CPPCHECK] (GC_signal_mark_stack_overflow): Pass msp argument
to GC_noop1().
* mark.c [CPPCHECK] (GC_steal_mark_stack): Pass local argument to
GC_noop1().
* misc.c [CPPCHECK] (GC_default_warn_proc): Pass msg argument to
GC_noop1(); add comment.
* tests/gctest.c [CPPCHECK] (warn_proc): Likewise.
* tests/disclaim.c [CPPCHECK] (misc_sizes_dct, pair_dct): Pass cd
argument to GC_noop1().
* tests/gctest.c [CPPCHECK] (reverse_test_inner): Pass data argument to
GC_noop1().
* tests/gctest.c (test_tinyfl): Do not call GC_CONS() if CPPCHECK; add
comment.
* tests/gctest.c [!DBG_HDRS_ALL && CPPCHECK] (run_one_test): Pass x
argument to GC_noop1().
* tests/threadkey.c [CPPCHECK] (on_thread_exit_inner): Pass sb, arg
arguments to GC_noop1().
* tests/weakmap.c [CPPCHECK] (set_mark_bit): Pass obj argument to
GC_noop1().
* win32_threads.c [!I386 && !X86_64 && !ARM32 && !AARCH64 && !SHx
&& !MIPS && !PPC && !ALPHA && CPPCHECK] (copy_ptr_regs): Pass regs
argument to GC_noop1().
* win32_threads.c [CPPCHECK] (GC_win32_start_inner): Pass sb argument
to GC_noop1().

Use BZERO() to clear jmp_buf variable in GC_with_callee_saves_pushed
(refactoring)

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* mach_dep.c [!HAVE_PUSH_REGS && !EMSCRIPTEN && !(NO_CRT && MSWIN32)
&& !HAVE_BUILTIN_UNWIND_INIT] (GC_with_callee_saves_pushed): Use
BZERO() to clear regs local variable; remove i and lim local variables.

Workaround 'struct member link_map::l_name is never used' cppcheck warning

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* dyn_load.c [LINUX && !USE_PROC_FOR_LIBRARIES && CPPCHECK
&& HOST_ANDROID && !GC_DONT_DEFINE_LINK_MAP && __ANDROID_API__<21]
(GC_register_dynamic_libraries): Call GC_noop1() for lm->l_name,
lm->l_ld and lm->l_prev.

Workaround 'uninitialized variable pos.cur_pos' cppcheck FP in cord files

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* cord/cordprnt.c [CPPCHECK] (CORD_vsprintf): Explicitly initialize pos
local variable using memset.
* cord/cordxtra.c [CPPCHECK] (CORD_cmp, CORD_ncmp): Explicitly
initialize xpos, ypos local variables using memset.
* cord/cordxtra.c [CPPCHECK] (CORD_fetch, CORD_str): Explicitly
initialize xpos local variable using memset.
* cord/tests/de.c [!WIN32 && CPPCHECK] (replace_line): Explicitly
initialize p local variable using memset.

Workaround 'condition weakmap_trylock()!=0' is always false' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* tests/weakmap.c (weakmap_trylock): Define only if GC_PTHREADS.
* tests/weakmap.c (weakmap_disclaim): Call weakmap_trylock() only if
GC_PTHREADS.

Workaround 'AST broken' cppcheck internal error in cpptest

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* tests/cpp.cc (main): Do not declare and set d local variable if
CPPCHECK.

Workaround 'null ptr dereference' cppcheck FP in remove_all_threads_but_me

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* pthread_support.c [CAN_HANDLE_FORK && CPPCHECK]
(GC_remove_all_threads_but_me): Abort if me is NULL.

Workaround 'GC_arrays._static_roots[] accessed out of bounds' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* mark_rts.c [!THREADS && CPPCHECK] (GC_is_static_root): Abort if
n_root_sets is greater than MAX_ROOT_SETS.

Eliminate 'C-style pointer casting' cppcheck warning in symbian.cpp

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* extra/symbian.cpp (GC_get_private_path_and_zero_file): Use
static_cast (to cast to char*) instead of the C-style cast.

Workaround 'if condition is same as previous if condition' cppcheck FP

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* alloc.c [THREAD_LOCAL_ALLOC] (GC_stopped_mark): Set GC_world_stopped
to true only if THREADS.
* alloc.c [THREADS && !THREAD_LOCAL_ALLOC && CPPCHECK]
(GC_stopped_mark): Add no-op operation; add comment.

Remove unneeded pointer casts of HDR() argument
(refactoring)

* ptr_chck.c (GC_same_obj, GC_is_valid_displacement, GC_is_visible):
Remove cast to word of HDR() argument.

Declare variables and arguments as pointer to const where applicable
(refactoring)

Issue #629 (bdwgc).

* allchblk.c (setup_header): Declare ok local variable as const
pointer.
* mallocx.x (GC_realloc): Likewise.
* allchblk.c (GC_free_block_ending_at): Declare hhdr local variable as
const pointer.
* backgraph.c (per_object_helper): Likewise.
* checksums.c (GC_add_block): Likewise.
* dbg_mlc.c (GC_debug_free, GC_debug_realloc, GC_check_heap_block):
Likewise.
* finalize.c (GC_ignore_self_finalize_mark_proc,
GC_register_finalizer_inner): Likewise.
* malloc.c (GC_free): Likewise.
* mallocx.c (GC_get_kind_and_size): Likewise.
* misc.c (GC_size, block_add_size): Likewise.
* ptr_chck.c (GC_is_visible): Likewise.
* reclaim.c (GC_print_block_descr, GC_continue_reclaim,
GC_reclaim_all, GC_do_enumerate_reachable_objects): Likewise.
* reclaim.c [!EAGER_SWEEP && ENABLE_DISCLAIM]
(GC_reclaim_unconditionally_marked): Likewise.
* allchblk.c [GC_ASSERTIONS && !USE_MUNMAP] (GC_add_to_fl): Declare
nexthdr, prevhdr local variables as const pointer.
* allchblk.c [USE_MUNMAP && COUNT_UNMAPPED_REGIONS]
(calc_num_unmapped_regions_delta): Likewise.
* allchblk.c (next_hblk_fits_better): Rename next_hdr local variable to
nexthdr; declare nexthdr local variable as const pointer.
* allchblk.c (next_hblk_fits_better): Specify hhdr argument as const
pointer.
* include/private/gc_pmark.h (GC_push_obj): Likewise.
* include/private/gc_priv.h (GC_block_empty): Likewise.
* malloc.c (free_internal): Likewise.
* mark.c (GC_block_was_dirty, GC_push_marked, GC_push_unconditionally):
Likewise.
* reclaim.c (GC_block_empty, GC_block_nearly_full, GC_reclaim_clear,
GC_reclaim_uninit, GC_reclaim_check, GC_n_set_marks): Likewise.
* alloc.c (GC_set_fl_marks, GC_clear_fl_marks): Declare last_h local
variable as const pointer.
* blacklst.c (GC_copy_bl): Specify old argument as const pointer.
* cord/cordbscs.c (CORD_extend_path, CORD__next, CORD__prev): Declare
current_pe local variable as const pointer.
* cord/cordbscs.c (CORD__pos_fetch, CORD__prev): Declare pe local
variable as const pointer.
* cord/cordprnt.c (CORD_vsprintf): Declare str local variable as const
pointer.
* misc.c (GC_init): Likewise.
* cord/tests/de_win.c (plain_chars, control_chars): Specify text
argument as const pointer.
* cord/tests/de_win.c (control_chars): Declare text local variable as
const pointer.
* dyn_load.c [SOLARISDL && !USE_PROC_FOR_LIBRARIES || (DGUX || HURD
|| NACL || SCO_ELF || (ANY_BSD || LINUX) && __ELF__)
&& !USE_PROC_FOR_LIBRARIES && !HAVE_DL_ITERATE_PHDR]
(GC_FirstDLOpenedLinkMap): Declare rd, lm local variables as const
pointer.
* dyn_load.c [DARWIN && !NO_DYLD_BIND_FULLY_IMAGE && !USE_DYLD_TO_BIND]
(GC_init_dyld): Declare dl_handle local variable as const pointer.
* dyn_load.c [PCR] (GC_register_dynamic_libraries): Declare p local
variable as const pointer.
* tests/gctest.c [!VERY_SMALL_CONFIG] (alloc_small): Likewise.
* tests/gctest.c [GC_REQUIRE_WCSDUP] (run_one_test): Likewise.
* extra/AmigaOS.c (GC_register_data_segments): Declare cli local
variable as const pointer.
* extra/msvc_dbg.c (GetFileLineFromAddress): Declare sourceName local
variable as const pointer.
* finalize.c (GC_print_finalization_stats): Declare fo local variable
as const pointer.
* include/private/gc_priv.h [REDIRECT_MALLOC && GC_LINUX_THREADS]
(GC_text_mapping): Specify nm argument as const pointer.
* os_dep.c [REDIRECT_MALLOC && GC_LINUX_THREADS] (GC_text_mapping):
Likewise.
* include/private/specific.h (GC_getspecific): Declare entry local
variable as const pointer.
* mark.c [USE_PUSH_MARKED_ACCELERATORS] (GC_push_marked1,
GC_push_marked2, GC_push_marked4): Declare mark_word_addr local
variable as const pointer.
* mark_rts.c (GC_push_roots): Declare base local variable as const
pointer.
* misc.c (GC_envfile_getenv): Declare end_of_content local variable as
const pointer.
* misc.c [(UNIX_LIKE && !GC_ANDROID_LOG || CONSOLE_LOG && MSWIN32
|| CYGWIN32 || SYMBIAN) && !SMALL_CONFIG] (GC_init): Rename file_name
local variable to fname.
* misc.c [(UNIX_LIKE && !GC_ANDROID_LOG || CONSOLE_LOG && MSWIN32
|| CYGWIN32 || SYMBIAN) && !SMALL_CONFIG] (GC_init): Declare fname
local variable as const pointer.
* tools/if_not_there.c (main): Likewise.
* misc.c (GC_init): Rename backtraces_string, addr_string, string,
time_limit_string, full_freq_string, interval_string,
space_divisor_string, sz_str local variables to str.
* misc.c [ENABLE_TRACE] (GC_init): Change type of addr local variable
from word to ptr_t.
* os_dep.c [GWW_VDB] (GC_gww_read_dirty): Declare last_warned,
pages_end local variables as const pointer; cast h local variable to
ptr_t instead of char*.
* os_dep.c [MPROTECT_VDB && DARWIN && BROKEN_EXCEPTION_HANDLING]
(catch_exception_raise): Declare last_fault local variable as const
pointer.
* os_dep.c [NEED_CALLINFO && LINUX && !SMALL_CONFIG]
(GC_print_callers): Declare old_preload local variable as const
pointer.
* pthread_support.c (GC_thr_init): Declare nprocs_string local variable
as const pointer.
* pthread_support.c [PARALLEL_MARK] (GC_thr_init): Declare
markers_string local variables as const pointer.
* win32_threads.c [PARALLEL_MARK] (GC_thr_init): Likewise.
* tests/cpp.cc (D::CleanUp): Declare self local variable as const
pointer.
* tests/cpp.cc (main): Add const to argv argument.
* tests/disclaim_bench.c (main): Likewise.
* tests/cpp.cc (main): Declare xio, a local variables as const
pointer.
* tests/gctest.c (test_generic_malloc_or_special): Specify p argument
as const pointer.
* tests/gctest.c (mktree): Declare tmp local variable as const pointer.
* tests/gctest.c [!VERY_SMALL_CONFIG && GC_PTHREADS && !(SMALL_CONFIG
|| GC_DEBUG)] (alloc8bytes): Declare next local variable as const
pointer.
* tests/weakmap.c (weakmap_disclaim): Declare old_obj local variable as
const pointer.
* typd_mlc.c (GC_array_mark_proc): Remove hhdr local variable.

Use GC_HIDE_POINTER() in small_cons_uncollectable() of gctest
(refactoring)

Issue #627 (bdwgc).

* tests/gctest.c (small_cons_uncollectable): Use GC_HIDE_POINTER().
* tests/gctest.c (UNCOLLECTABLE_CDR): Use GC_REVEAL_POINTER().

Define AO_t to size_t instead of word
(refactoring)

* include/private/gc_atomic_ops.h [GC_BUILTIN_ATOMIC] (AO_t): Define to
size_t instead of GC_word.
* tests/gctest.c [!AO_HAVE_compiler_barrier] (AO_t): Likewise.
* tests/weakmap.c [!GC_PTHREADS && AO_HAVE_compiler_barrier] (AO_t):
Likewise.
* include/private/gc_atomic_ops.h [GC_BUILTIN_ATOMIC]
(AO_fetch_and_sub1): Do not use GC_signed_word; replace -1 to ~(AO_t)0.
* tests/gctest.c [GC_GCJ_SUPPORT] (gcj_cons): Change type of cnt local
variable from GC_word to size_t.
* tests/gctest.c (chktree): Cast result of AO_fetch_and_add1() to
size_t instead of unsigned int.

Define internal PTR_ALIGN_DOWN/UP macros
(refactoring)

Issue #627 (bdwgc).

Also, change sizeof(word) to sizeof(ptr_t) where PTR_ALIGN_DOWN/UP
macros are used.

* allchblk.c (find_nonbl_hblk): Change type of search_end local
variable from word to ptr_t.
* allchblk.c (find_nonbl_hblk): Use PTR_ALIGN_DOWN().
* dyn_load.c [HAVE_DL_ITERATE_PHDR && PT_GNU_RELRO && CPP_WORDSZ==64]
(GC_register_dynlib_callback): Likewise.
* dyn_load.c [ANY_MSWIN && !THREADS] (GC_cond_add_roots): Likewise.
* include/private/gc_priv.h (HBLKPTR, HBLK_PAGE_ALIGNED): Likewise.
* mark.c (GC_push_all, GC_custom_push_range, GC_push_all_eager,
GC_push_all_stack): Likewise.
* mark.c [!GC_DISABLE_INCREMENTAL] (GC_push_selected): Likewise.
* mark_rts.c (GC_add_roots_inner, GC_remove_roots_inner,
GC_exclude_static_roots): Likewise.
* misc.c [!ALWAYS_SMALL_CLEAR_STACK && !STACK_NOT_SCANNED]
(GC_clear_stack): Likewise.
* misc.c (GC_base): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [OPENBSD] (GC_skip_hole_openbsd): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [ANY_MSWIN && !CYGWIN32] (GC_get_stack_base): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [NEED_FIND_LIMIT || USE_PROC_FOR_LIBRARIES && THREADS]
(GC_find_limit_with_bound): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [HPUX_STACK_BOTTOM] (GC_get_register_stack_base): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [!ECOS && !NOSYS && !SYMBIAN && !EMSCRIPTEN && !AMIGA
&& !EMBOX && !HAIKU && !OS2 && !ANY_MSWIN && !GC_OPENBSD_THREADS
&& (!GC_SOLARIS_THREADS || _STRICT_STDC) && !STACKBOTTOM && HEURISTIC1
&& STACK_GROWS_UP] (GC_get_main_stack_base): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [MSWIN32] (GC_least_described_address): Likewise.
* dyn_load.c [HAVE_DL_ITERATE_PHDR && PT_GNU_RELRO && CPP_WORDSZ==64]
(GC_register_dynlib_callback): Change sizeof(word) to sizeof(ptr_t).
* mark.c (GC_push_all_eager, GC_push_all_stack): Likewise.
* mark_rts.c (GC_add_roots_inner, GC_remove_roots_inner,
GC_exclude_static_roots): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [!ANY_MSWIN && (SVR4 || AIX || DGUX) && !PCR]
(GC_SysVGetDataStart): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [DATASTART_USES_BSDGETDATASTART] (GC_FreeBSDGetDataStart):
Likewise.
* dyn_load.c [(SOLARISDL || LINUX) && !USE_PROC_FOR_LIBRARIES]
(GC_register_dynamic_libraries): Remove redundant parentheses.
* dyn_load.c [HAVE_DL_ITERATE_PHDR && PT_GNU_RELRO]
(GC_register_dynlib_callback): Use PTR_ALIGN_UP() instead of
PTRT_ROUNDUP_BY_MASK().
* include/private/gcconfig.h [M68K && LINUX && !__ELF__ || I386
&& (SEQUENT || HAIKU || SCO || LINUX && !__ELF__ || DJGPP) || MIPS
&& EWS4800 && _MIPS_SZPTR!=64 || M88K && CX_UX] (DATASTART): Likewise.
* include/private/gcconfig.h [MIPS && EWS4800 && _MIPS_SZPTR!=64]
(DATASTART2): Likewise.
* mark.c (GC_push_all, GC_custom_push_range, GC_push_all_eager,
GC_push_all_stack): Likewise.
* mark.c [!GC_DISABLE_INCREMENTAL] (GC_push_selected): Likewise.
* mark_rts.c (GC_add_roots_inner, GC_remove_roots_inner,
GC_exclude_static_roots): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [!ECOS && !NOSYS && !SYMBIAN && !EMSCRIPTEN && !AMIGA
&& !EMBOX && !HAIKU && !OS2 && !ANY_MSWIN && !GC_OPENBSD_THREADS
&& (!GC_SOLARIS_THREADS || _STRICT_STDC) && !STACKBOTTOM && HEURISTIC1
&& !STACK_GROWS_UP] (GC_get_main_stack_base): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [!ANY_MSWIN && (SVR4 || AIX || DGUX) && !PCR]
(GC_SysVGetDataStart): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [DATASTART_USES_BSDGETDATASTART] (GC_FreeBSDGetDataStart):
Likewise.
* os_dep.c [MMAP_SUPPORTED && !MSWIN_XBOX1] (GC_unix_mmap_get_mem):
Likewise.
* os_dep.c [!MSWIN_XBOX1 && !MSWINCE && USE_WINALLOC && MSWIN32
&& !MSWINRT_FLAVOR] (GC_win32_get_mem): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [USE_MUNMAP] (GC_unmap_start): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [MPROTECT_VDB && DONT_PROTECT_PTRFREE] (GC_protect_heap):
Likewise.
* os_dep.c [PROC_VDB] (GC_proc_read_dirty): Likewise.
* os_dep.c [MPROTECT_VDB] (GC_remove_protection): Likewise.
* dyn_load.c [ANY_MSWIN] (GC_cond_add_roots): Change type of base and
limit arguments from char* to ptr_t.
* dyn_load.c [ANY_MSWIN && !THREADS] (GC_cond_add_roots): Change type
of stack_top local variable from char* to ptr_t.
* dyn_load.c [ANY_MSWIN] (GC_register_dynamic_libraries): Change type
of p local variable from PVOID to ptr_t; change type of base, limit,
new_limit local variables from char* to ptr_t.
* dyn_load.c [ANY_MSWIN && MSWINCE] (GC_register_dynamic_libraries):
Use PTR_ALIGN_UP().
* include/private/gcconfig.h (PTR_ALIGN_DOWN): New macro.
* include/private/gcconfig.h (PTRT_ROUNDUP_BY_MASK): Define
PTR_ALIGN_UP() macro instead.
* mark.c (GC_push_all_eager, GC_push_all_stack): Change type of lim
local variable from word* to ptr_t.
* misc.c (GC_base): Declare limit and sz local variables at the
beginning of the function.
* os_dep.c [OPENBSD] (GC_skip_hole_openbsd): Change type of pgsz local
variable from word to size_t.

Fix undefined behavior caused by potential overflow in MAKE_COOLER

Issue #612 (bdwgc).

Check for a potential overflow before the addition (or subtraction)
operation.

This commit also changes the behavior of MAKE_COOLER() in case of the
overflow - it retains the pointer unchanged instead of setting it to
zero or GC_WORD_MAX.  This change should not affect the logic of
GC_clear_stack() which uses MAKE_COOLER().

* include/private/gc_priv.h (MAKE_COOLER): Rename x,y arguments to p,d;
do not perform addition/subtraction if it may lead to overflow; do
nothing to p if overflow is expected.

Pass size_t instead of word values to GC_malloc in hugetest
(refactoring)

Issue #627 (bdwgc).

* tests/huge.c (GC_WORD_MAX): Rename to SIZE_MAX; change its type from
GC_word to size_t.
* tests/huge.c (SIZE_MAX): Undefine it (before definition).
* tests/huge.c (GC_SWORD_MAX): Rename to U_SSIZE_MAX; change type from
GC_signed_word to size_t (unsigned).
* tests/huge.c (main): Rename GC_WORD_MAX to SIZE_MAX; rename
GC_SWORD_MAX to U_SSIZE_MAX.

Fix double lock in GC_malloc called from backtrace()

Issue #613 (bdwgc).

As backtrace() might call a redirected malloc, we need to release the
allocator lock temporarily before backtrace() call, and we should not
call backtrace() at all for the cases where it is not possible to
release the allocator lock temporarily (i.e. for internal allocations).

* dbg_mlc.c [DBG_HDRS_ALL] (GC_debug_generic_malloc_inner): Call
ADD_CALL_CHAIN_INNER() instead of ADD_CALL_CHAIN().
* include/private/dbg_mlc.h [SAVE_CALL_CHAIN && REDIRECT_MALLOC
&& THREADS && DBG_HDRS_ALL && NARGS==0 && NFRAMES%2==0
&& GC_HAVE_BUILTIN_BACKTRACE] (GC_save_callers_no_unlock): Declare
function.
* include/private/dbg_mlc.h [DBG_HDRS_ALL] (ADD_CALL_CHAIN_INNER):
Define.
* os_dep.c [NEED_CALLINFO && SAVE_CALL_CHAIN && NARGS==0
&& NFRAMES%2==0 && GC_HAVE_BUILTIN_BACKTRACE && REDIRECT_MALLOC
&& THREADS && DBG_HDRS_ALL]: Include dbg_mlc.h.
* os_dep.c [NEED_CALLINFO && SAVE_CALL_CHAIN && NARGS==0
&& NFRAMES%2==0 && GC_HAVE_BUILTIN_BACKTRACE && REDIRECT_MALLOC
&& THREADS && DBG_HDRS_ALL] (GC_save_callers_no_unlock): Implement.
* os_dep.c [NEED_CALLINFO && SAVE_CALL_CHAIN && NARGS==0
&& NFRAMES%2==0 && GC_HAVE_BUILTIN_BACKTRACE && REDIRECT_MALLOC]
(GC_save_callers): Wrap backtrace() into UNLOCK/LOCK(); add comment.

Fix ADD_CALL_CHAIN() placement to follow GC_store_debug_info_inner call

Issue #613 (bdwgc).

This might be important for the case of malloc redirection as
backtrace() need to be called without the allocator lock held.

* dbg_mlc.c (store_debug_info, GC_debug_generic_malloc_inner): Call
ADD_CALL_CHAIN() right after GC_store_debug_info_inner() call (instead
of before it).
* gcj_mlc.c (GC_debug_gcj_malloc): Likewise.
* dbg_mlc.c (GC_debug_generic_malloc_inner): Declare result local
variable.

Rename p argument to base in dbg_mlc.c/h
(refactoring)

* dbg_mlc.c [!SHORT_DBG_HDRS] (GC_has_other_debug_info): Reformat
comment.
* dbg_mlc.c [!SHORT_DBG_HDRS] (GC_has_other_debug_info): Rename p
argument to base; update comment.
* dbg_mlc.c (GC_store_debug_info_inner, store_debug_info,
GC_print_obj, GC_debug_print_heap_obj_proc): Likewise.
* include/private/dbg_mlc.h (GC_has_other_debug_info,
GC_HAS_DEBUG_INFO): Likewise.
* dbg_mlc.c [KEEP_BACK_PTRS] (GC_print_backtrace): Remove comment (as
duplicated in gc_backptr.h).
* dbg_mlc.c (GC_print_obj): Assume the argument points to object base
(i.e. do not call GC_base()).
* dbg_mlc.c (GC_debug_malloc, GC_debug_malloc_ignore_off_page,
GC_debug_malloc_atomic_ignore_off_page, GC_debug_generic_malloc,
GC_debug_malloc_atomic, GC_debug_malloc_uncollectable): Rename result
local variable to base.
* dbg_mlc.c [DBG_HDRS_ALL] (GC_debug_generic_malloc_inner): Likewise.
* dbg_mlc.c [GC_ATOMIC_UNCOLLECTABLE]
(GC_debug_malloc_atomic_uncollectable): Likewise.
* dbg_mlc.c [!GC_NO_FINALIZATION] (GC_debug_register_finalizer,
GC_debug_register_finalizer_no_order,
GC_debug_register_finalizer_unreachable,
GC_debug_register_finalizer_ignore_self): Reformat code.
* gcj_mlc.c (GC_debug_gcj_malloc): Declare base local variable and use
it to keep pointer to the base of the allocated object.
* include/private/dbg_mlc.h (ADD_CALL_CHAIN): Adjust comment.
